info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 13 at 12:37AM CDT until May 13 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT FOR EASTERN MEDINA...EASTERN BANDERA...SOUTHEASTERN KERR... SOUTHWESTERN GUADALUPE...NORTHWESTERN ATASCOSA...KENDALL...BEXAR AND CENTRAL COMAL COUNTIES... At 1237 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Nelson City to near Leon Valley to 9 miles east of Bigfoot, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... San Antonio, Schertz, Cibolo, Universal City, Live Oak, Boerne, Selma, Devine, Castroville, Bandera, Stinson Municipal Airport, San Antonio Int Airport, Randolph AFB, Canyon Lake, Leon Valley, Helotes, Fair Oaks Ranch, Kirby, Alamo Heights and Windcrest. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
